Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of actor wearing comedy mask. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white coating, pink paint on skin and red lips. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably locally produced at the Naukratis terracottas workshop that dates 3rd to 2nd century BC. Parallels from Naukratis at the British Museum.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.303) (Phase 1)
